intro: Silene breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene breviflora is often found in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and along streambanks.
